data.title: Harry (Calvert) Verney 2nd Bt (1801-1894)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Harry (Calvert) Verney 2nd Bt born 1801 London, Middlesex, England died 1894 Claydon House, Middle Claydon, Buckinghamshire, England including ancestors + descendants + 5 photos + 2 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 11 Nov 2023 | Created 1 Apr 2017

This page has been accessed 1,282 times.

Biography

Harry (Calvert) Verney 2nd Bt is Notable.

Sir Harry Verney, 2nd Baronet PC, DL, JP (8 December 1801 – 12 February 1894) was an English soldier and Liberal politician who sat in the House of Commons variously between 1832 and 1885.

He was born on 8 December 1801, the son of General Sir Harry Calvert, 1st Bt. and Caroline Hammersley.

He was given the name of Harry Calvert at birth. He succeeded to the title of 2nd Baronet Calvert, of Claydon House, co. Bucks [U.K., 1818] on 3 September 1826. On 9 February 1827 his name was legally changed to Harry Verney by Royal Licence. He was then able to inherit the Verney family estates of his cousin, Mary Verney, 1st Baroness Fermanagh.[1]

He married, firstly, Eliza Hope-Vere, daughter of Admiral Sir George Hope-Vere and Hon. Georgiana Mary Anne Kinnaird, on 30 June 1835.

Children of Sir Harry Verney, 2nd Bt. and Eliza Hope-Vere include:

Catherine Eliza Verney (1837-1856)

Sir Edmund Hope Verney, 3rd Bt. (1838-1910)

Harry Calvert Verney (1840-1851)

George Hope Lloyd-Verney (1842-1896)

Frederick William Verney (1846-1913)

He married, secondly, Frances Parthenope Nightingale, daughter of William Edward Nightingale, on 24 June 1858.

He died on 12 February 1894 at age 92.

Sir Harry Verney (1801-1894) was the son of General Sir Harry Calvert, 1st Bt. and Caroline Hammersley.

He was given the name of Harry Calvert at birth. On 9 February 1827 his name was legally changed to Harry Verney by Royal Licence in order to be able to inherit the Verney family estates of his cousin Mary Verney, 1st Baroness Fermanagh.

He married, firstly, Eliza Hope-Vere, daughter of Admiral Sir George Hope-Vere and Hon. Georgiana Mary Anne Kinnaird, on 30 June 1835, and had by her four sons and three daughters.

After her death in 1857, Verney remarried to Frances Parthenope Nightingale, daughter of William Edward Nightingale and sister of Florence Nightingale on the 24th of June 1858 in St Margaret's Church, East Wellow, Hampshire, England.

He died on 12 February 1894 at age 92 at Claydon House, Middle Claydon, Buckinghamshire, England

Sir Harry Verney, 2nd Bt. was born on 8 December 1801.1 He was the son of General Sir Harry Calvert, 1st Bt. and Caroline Hammersley.2 He married, firstly, Eliza Hope-Vere, daughter of Admiral Sir George Hope-Vere and Hon. Georgiana Mary Anne Kinnaird, on 30 June 1835.1 He married, secondly, Frances Parthenope Nightingale, daughter of William Edward Nightingale and Frances Smith, on 24 June 1858.1 He died on 12 February 1894 at age 92.1 He was given the name of Harry Calvert at birth.1 He succeeded as the 2nd Baronet Calvert, of Claydon House, co. Bucks [U.K., 1818] on 3 September 1826.1 On 9 February 1827 his name was legally changed to Harry Verney by Royal Licence.1 He gained the rank of Major in the 1st Grenadier Guards.1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) (Liberal) for Buckingham between 1832 and 1841.1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) (Liberal) for Bedford between 1847 and 1852.1 He held the office of Deputy Lieutenant (D.L.)1 He was appointed Privy Counsellor (P.C.)1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) (Liberal) for Buckingham between 1857 and 1874.1 He held the office of Member of Parliament (M.P.) (Liberal) for Buckingham between 1880 and 1885.
